intro: Chaenorhinum minus var. gracile, commonly known as the slender horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are usually pink to red, with a distinctive horn-like structure at the base of the petals. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
